Problem:
Analyze a system where \\(y(t)\\) undergoes a Fourier Transform \\(F(y)(\\omega) = \\int_{-\\infty}^{\\infty} y(t)e^{-i\\omega t} dt\\), giving a transformed function in the frequency domain. Consider effects of an inverse transformation and external modulation by a function \\(h(t)\\) applied at a specific time.

If a modulation by a function \\(h(t) = e^{iCt}y(t)\\), where \\(C\\) is a constant, is applied at a time \\(t_1\\), will the inverse Fourier Transform at time \\(T > t_1\\) reveal the only the influences of \\(h(t)\\) and not inherent characteristics of the original \\(y(t)\\)?
Explanation: The inverse Fourier Transform will reveal a signal influenced both by the original characteristics of \\(y(t)\\) and the modulation \\(h(t)\\). The additional modulation adjusts, but does not completely mask, the characteristics of \\(y(t)\\).
